finalists.name: Mickey
finalists.note: Won via Ryan's tiebreak vote (3–3–2 initial)

finalists.name: Ryan
finalists.note: Fire-making champion; casts deciding tiebreak vote

placements.name: Mickey
placements.notes: Won FTC via tiebreak (3–3–2; Ryan breaks tie) • 0 votes against • Iron Person winner profile

placements.name: Sky
placements.notes: 3 FTC votes • Most dominant competitor: 4 total wins, 3 immunities • Late-game closer

placements.name: Ryan
placements.notes: 2 FTC votes • Fire-making champion • Kingmaker tiebreak vote • Fan Favorite

placements.name: Scarlett
placements.notes: Lost fire-making at Final 4 • Best Strategic Player

placements.name: Sugar
placements.notes: Most votes against (10) • Still reached Final 5

placements.name: Dave
placements.notes: 3–3 vote; eliminated after Sky’s idol play flipped the outcome

placements.name: Rodney
placements.notes: 3–1 vote • Used Knowledge Is Power to steal an idol

placements.name: Josee
placements.notes: 6–5 vote • KIP theft + idol chaos round; unluckiest exit

winner.name: Mickey
winner.description: Won with structure + threat management; never became the real target; closed a 3–3–2 tie by securing Ryan’s kingmaker vote.

fanFavorite.name: Ryan
fanFavorite.description: Most visible presence in merge/endgame; made FTC and became deciding vote in the tiebreak.

bestStrategic.name: Scarlett
bestStrategic.description: Highest long-game strategic output; survived chaos and shifting blocs; fell only at fire-making.

bestSocial.name: Mickey
bestSocial.description: Quietly decisive social game; overlap relationships kept votes from consolidating on him.

bestPhysical.name: Sky
bestPhysical.description: Best challenge performer: 4 total wins, 3 immunities; won key late rounds.

perfectIdolPlay.name: Sky
perfectIdolPlay.description: Final 6 idol play on Sugar redirected boot to Dave and reshaped the endgame.

mostChaotic.name: Blaineley
mostChaotic.description: Weaponized chaos; constant heat but survived through chaos math and advantage leverage.

fireMakingChampion.name: Ryan
fireMakingChampion.description: Won fire-making to reach FTC; created the tie scenario and kingmaker finish.

mostVotesAgainstJury.name: Sugar
mostVotesAgainstJury.description: Most targeted player by raw vote count while still making the jury phase / endgame.

ironPerson.name: Mickey
ironPerson.description: Never visibly on the ropes across swap/merge/endgame; classic stable winner profile.

mostUnlucky.name: Josee
mostUnlucky.description: Lost protection when Knowledge Is Power stripped her idol; failed Shot in the Dark and became fallback boot.

idolsFound.name: Sky
idolsFound.note: Found at F6 (played on Sugar) and F5 (played on herself)

idolsFound.name: Josee
idolsFound.note: Beware idol conversion (later stolen by KIP before play)

idolsFound.name: Shawn
idolsFound.note: Beware idol conversion (used on Topher at Earn-the-Merge)

advantages.name: Rodney
advantages.note: Used at Earn-the-Merge to steal Josee’s idol

advantages.name: Max
advantages.note: Left Tribal to avoid voting/being voted

advantages.name: Mickey
advantages.note: Restored a lost vote; expired unused

advantages.name: Blaineley
advantages.note: Claimed advantages if she survived Tribal

advantages.name: Shawn/Josee/Topher
advantages.note: Stages to Extra Vote; later became Shawn solo idol

legacy.summary: Introduced 18 new players (Gen 3) and a Survivor-style twist gauntlet (3 tribes, swap, split-tribal merge round, vote-loss twists, and Final 4 fire-making). Mickey won with 0 votes against and survived a 3-3-2 FTC tie thanks to Ryan's deciding tiebreak vote — proving that clean positioning and relationships can beat pure challenge dominance.
memorableMoments: Ryan's fire-making win and kingmaker vote
